intro: Rohria grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered rohria, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a glossy surface.
